title: Understanding Matrix Inverse
text: To find the inverse of a 2x2 matrix, we use a specific formula. Not all matrices have inverses. A matrix can have an inverse only if it is non-singular, meaning its determinant is not zero.

title: Determinant of a 2x2 Matrix
text: For a matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$, the determinant is calculated as ad-bc. Why do you think it's important to find the determinant first when finding the inverse?

title: Formula for the Inverse
text: If the determinant is not zero, the inverse of the matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$ is given by 1/(ad-bc)* $$\begin{bmatrix} d & -b \\ -c & a \end{bmatrix}$$. Knowing this, what would be your first step for the given matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} -4 & -3 \\ -5 & 8 \end{bmatrix}$$?
